lead_paragraph: Both Fresno, Calif., and Santa Fe, N.M., face dire water shortages, but only one has embraced tiered pricing, where heavy users pay much more per gallon.

headline.print_headline: Two Thirsty Cities: In One, Guzzlers Pay More, and Use Less
headline.main: Water Pricing in Two Thirsty Cities: In One, Guzzlers Pay More, and Use Less

snippet: Both Fresno, Calif., and Santa Fe, N.M., face dire water shortages, but only one has embraced tiered pricing, where heavy users pay much more per gallon.
abstract: Santa Fe, NM, facing drought, has adopted tiered water pricing system under which heaviest water users pay much more for water; practice effectively subsidizes system, while modest users face only modest price increase; system has brought about desired reduction in water usage, while economists praise it as balance between utility and fairness; Fresno, Calif, which has resisted such regulations but has increased rates, still maintains relatively high water usage.
